column5: I have a pellet gun pistol.. I have not used in awhile, since I have moved back into the city from the country I am wondering about the ramifications of shooting targets in my backyard..  Is there any law stating I can't?  I am in Hamilton.  Thanks!  G.

http://www.hamilton.ca/NR/rdonlyres/6B512F07-8535-4A14-AC46-D24735E4AD6F/0/05114.pdf  Looks like your toast. Although the CCC states a minimum velocity/sec, the municipalities create their own and include specific definitions such as Longbow, Xbow, etc...Pellet guns..etc.  Take a look at Section # 2, subsection # 5 under definitions...  Unless your part of the exemptions in Section # 5, I think you outta luck.
Looks like I will be selling it... Thank you.  G
Well i do like to have one in the boat.......if your thinking of selling let me know....there are to many of those black fish eating birds in my area ...if you know what i mean
No Dont Sell It!!!!!!!!!!!! bring it to lakeair, i have one too. saturday night , after a few beers, we will get someone to put the skunk hat on TJ it will be just like at the carnival
and it would be impossible to miss!! even drunk! he makes a pretty big target!  G
If he wears that pink tutu you'll be laughing so hard you wouldn't be able to hit him if he was sitting on the barrel of the gun LOL.
